Pre-Game Insights: India has an undefeated streak against Pakistan in the ICC World Cup.
Both teams have a decent practice under their belt, having played two practice matches each.
India won both their warm-up matches, beating England and Australia, while Pakistan defeated West Indies by seven wickets and lost to South Africa.
Both the teams have the lethal bowling attack in T20 cricket.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch in Dubai has been excellent for batting, but in the last few IPL matches, the track is slowing down slightly as the game progresses.
Nine out of 12 matches have been won by the chasing teams in the recently concluded IPL.
India has a 5-0 head-to-head record against Pakistan in the ICC T20 World Cup.

The predicted playing XI for India includes KL Rahul, Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli (c), Suryakumar Yadav, Rishabh Pant (wk), Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Shardul Thakur, Ravichandran Ashwin/Varun Chakravarthy, Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami, and for Pakistan includes Mohammad Rizwan (wk), Babar Azam (c), Fakhar Zaman, Mohammad Hafeez, Shoaib Malik, Asif Ali, Hasan Ali, Shadab Khan, Imad Wasim, Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf.
Others: The match will be played at Dubai International Cricket Stadium on 24th October 2021 at 19:30 IST | 14:00 GMT | 20:00 local.
The average first innings score is 168.
The record of chasing teams is Won – 9, Lost – 3, Tied – 0.
